verses.verse: (God the Creator and Provider) (Ps 103.1) Bless the LORD, O my soul. O LORD my God, you are very great. You are clothed with honor and majesty,
(Isa 40.22; Dan 7.9) wrapped in light as with a garment. You stretch out the heavens like a tent;
(Ps 18.10; Isa 19.1; Am 9.6) you set the beams of your (Heb his) chambers on the waters; you make the clouds your (Heb his) chariot; you ride on the wings of the wind;
(Heb 1.7) you make the winds your (Heb his) messengers, fire and flame your (Heb his) ministers.
(Job 26.7; Ps 24.2) You set the earth on its foundations, so that it shall never be shaken.
(Gen 7.19) You cover it with the deep as with a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.
At your rebuke they flee; at the sound of your thunder they take to flight.
(Ps 33.7) They rose up to the mountains, ran down to the valleys, to the place that you appointed for them.
(Job 38.10, 11; Jer 5.22) You set a boundary that they may not pass, so that they might not again cover the earth.
(Ps 107.35) You make springs gush forth in the valleys; they flow between the hills,
(Job 39.5) giving drink to every wild animal; the wild asses quench their thirst.
(Mt 8.20) By the streams (Heb By them) the birds of the air have their habitation; they sing among the branches.
(Ps 65.9; 147.8) From your lofty abode you water the mountains; the earth is satisfied with the fruit of your work.
(Gen 1.29; Job 28.5; 38.27; Ps 147.8) You cause the grass to grow for the cattle and plants for people to cultivate, to bring forth food from the earth
(Judg 9.13; Ps 23.5) and wine to gladden the human heart, oil to make the face shine and bread to strengthen the human heart.
The trees of the field (Gk: Heb trees of the LORD) are watered abundantly, the cedars of Lebanon that he planted.
In them the birds build their nests; the stork has its home in the fir trees.
(Prov 30.26) The high mountains are for the wild goats; the rocks are a refuge for the coneys.
(Gen 1.14) You have made the moon to mark the seasons; the sun knows its time for setting.
(Isa 45.7) You make darkness, and it is night, when all the animals of the forest come creeping out.
(Job 38.39) The young lions roar for their prey, seeking their food from God.
When the sun rises, they withdraw and lie down in their dens.
(Gen 3.19) People go out to their work and to their labor until the evening.
(Ps 40.5; 65.9; Prov 3.19) O LORD, how manifold are your works! In wisdom you have made them all; the earth is full of your creatures.
There is the sea, great and wide; creeping things innumerable are there, living things both small and great.
(Job 41.1; Ps 107.23) There go the ships and Leviathan that you formed to sport in it.
(Ps 136.25; 145.15) These all look to you to give them their food in due season;
when you give to them, they gather it up; when you open your hand, they are filled with good things.
(Job 34.14; Ps 146.4; Eccl 12.7) When you hide your face, they are dismayed; when you take away their breath, they die and return to their dust.
(Isa 32.15; Ezek 37.9) When you send forth your spirit, (Or your breath) they are created, and you renew the face of the ground.
(Gen 1.31) May the glory of the LORD endure forever; may the LORD rejoice in his worksâ€”
(Ps 97.4, 5; 144.5) who looks on the earth and it trembles, who touches the mountains and they smoke.
(Ps 63.4; 146.2) I will sing to the LORD as long as I live; I will sing praise to my God while I have being.
May my meditation be pleasing to him, for I rejoice in the LORD.
(v 1|PSA 104:1; Ps 37.10; 59.13) Let sinners be consumed from the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless the LORD, O my soul. Praise the LORD!
